title: Short-handed Seahawks coming to Cincinnati
text:
Short-handed Seahawks coming to Cincinnati 
Updated: Fri, Oct 09 2015, 08:45 PM 
CINCINNATI (Mike Berk) -- While the Bengals are dealing with a few injuries of their own, most notably to Safety George Iloka and Defensive End Wallace Gilberry, the Seahawks might be at a bigger disadvantage when the two teams meet this Sunday at 1 o'clock at Paul Brown Stadium. 
Seahawks' Running Back Marshawn Lynch has been ruled out of Sunday's game with lingering issues with the hamstring he injured two weeks ago against Chicago. Seattle did manage to win its last game without Lynch, on Monday night against the Lions. But taking care of the Bengals on the road without their workhorse back, could prove to be a much more daunting challenge for the two-time defending NFC champions. 
Iloka and Gilberry were both listed as "questionable" on Friday, which gives them a 25% chance of suiting up come Sunday. The Bengals are looking to improve to 5-0 this season. 

Photo Courtesy: AP Photo/Jeffrey Phelps, File
